source.365f94f6:
# Pie chart, where the slices will be ordered and plotted anti-clockwise:

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = 10,10
labels = df_new['status'].value_counts().index.tolist()
sizes = df_new['status'].value_counts().tolist()
explode = (0, 0.2, 0, 0)

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%',shadow=True, startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')
plt.title("What is start up companies current status", fontdict=None, position= [0.48,1], size = 'x-large')

plt.show()
source.677df732:
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = 15,8

height = df_new['category_code'].value_counts()[:45].tolist()
bars =  df_new['category_code'].value_counts()[:45].index.tolist()
y_pos = np.arange(len(bars))
plt.bar(y_pos, height , width=0.7 ,color= ['c']+['paleturquoise']*14)
plt.xticks(y_pos, bars)
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.title("All Start-Up market category", fontdict=None, position= [0.48,1.05], size = 'x-large')
plt.show()

source.d57bf146:
Q1 = df_new['raised_amount_usd'].quantile(0.25)
Q3 = df_new['raised_amount_usd'].quantile(0.75)
IQR = Q3 - Q1

lower_bound = (Q1 - 1.5 * IQR)
upper_bound = (Q3 + 1.5 * IQR)
source.575437fa:
without_outlier = df_new[(df_new['raised_amount_usd'] > lower_bound ) & (df_new['funding_total_usd'] < upper_bound)]

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = 15,6
plt.hist(without_outlier['raised_amount_usd'].dropna(), bins=30,color = 'paleturquoise' )

plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.xlabel('Funding (usd)')
plt.title("Distribution of total funding ", fontdict=None, position= [0.48,1.05], size = 'x-large')
plt.show()

source.8d279b31:
# Details about each csv file. ACQUISITIONS.CSV
Contains information about the startups that have been bought. DEGREE.CSV
Contains education background of the individuals involved in the startup world. FUNDING ROUNDS.CSV
CONTAIN INFORMATION ABOUT STARTUP FUNDING ROUNDS. FUNDS.CSV
Contains data on the ventures capital funds that make investments. INVESTMENT.CSV
Contains data on the type of various different investments made by venture capitalists. IPOs.CSV
Contsins data on initial public offerings. MILESTONES.CSV
Contains Significan events within the startup ecosystem OBJECT.CSV
Main file containing base information OFFICE.CSV
Contains information about startup company officers PEOPLE.CSV
Contains information of people in the startup world RELATIONSHIP.CSV
Contains relationship data that links companies to individual and their position

source.2d9be66c:
# Startup Investments Venture deals, organizations, people and exits. # Exploratory Data Analysis __Description__ The startup world is flourishing. There are hundreds of new companies being founded each day and venture capital has become a substantial asset class with yearly investments exceeding $100B in the US alone. Crunchbase 2013 Snapshot © 2013 dataset provides a glimpse into this exciting world. __Content__ This diverse dataset contains information about the startup ecosystem: organizations, individuals, company news, funding rounds, acquisitions, and IPOs. There are 11 tables that can be joined using unique IDs (schema to follow). More information about the individual data variables can be found on the Crunchabse Data website (under the API Entities Types section). __Acknowledgements__ This Crunchbase 2013 Snapshot © 2013 dataset is fully attributed to Crunchbase. __Inspiration__ There are multiple avenues for exploration: 1) EDA of the startup ecosystem.
2) Tracking and analyzing investment trends over time.
3) Clustering VC funds based on their existing investments.
4) Predicting which startup will proceed to raise further rounds will get acquired will file for an IPO.
5) Mapping the network of individuals involved in the startup ecosystem.
